metadata.title: CVE-2021-21224 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Type confusion in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 90.0.4430.85 allowed aremote attacker to execute arbitrary code inside a sandbox via a craftedHTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-21224` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 90.0.4430.93-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 90.0.4430.93-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 90.0.4430.93-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 90.0.4430.93-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 90.0.4430.93-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '90.0.4430.93-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
